conclusion: Determine the length L_n of the n-th metal cylinder and analyze the motion of the electron.
The electron starts from rest at t = 0.
The potential difference between the odd and even cylinders is U.
The electric field E between the plate and cylinder 1 is E = U/L_1.
The force on the electron is F = eE = eU/L_1.
The acceleration a of the electron is a = eU/mL_1.
The velocity v_1 is v_1 = sqrt(2eU/m).
The time t_1 to exit cylinder 1 is t_1 = L_1/sqrt(2eU/m).
The electron is accelerated again in the gap between cylinder 1 and cylinder 2.
The velocity v_2 as it enters cylinder 2 is v_2 = sqrt(4eU/m).
The time t_2 to exit cylinder 2 is t_2 = L_2/sqrt(4eU/m).
The velocity v_n as the electron enters the n-th cylinder is v_n = sqrt(2neU/m).
The time t_n to exit cylinder n is t_n = L_n/sqrt(2neU/m).
The total time to pass through n cylinders should be nT/2.
Solving for L_n, L_n = (1/2) sqrt(2neUmT^2/n^2) = (1/2) sqrt(2eUmT^2/n).
The length L_n of the n-th metal cylinder is L_n = (1/2) sqrt(2eUmT^2/n).
